Route

TransAtlanticWay - 1687km Race Route

The TransAtlanticWay is a one stage self-supported road bike ride between Dublin and Cork via The Wild Atlantic Way. A choice of two routes: Cu Culhainn â€“ 2500kms and Setanta â€“ 1700kms with the pounding swell of the Atlantic as your constant companion, you follow the blue zig-zag signposts through seven of Irelandâ€™s westernmost counties and be treated to many of Irelandâ€™s scenic showstoppers, welcoming towns and villages, heritage sites and plenty of unexpected thrills.

During the ride all responsibility lies with the rider, to be totally self-sufficient. There is some help with logistics provided by means of a bag and/or bike box drop at the start, and transfer of bags to the finish.

All riders are given and required to carry a gps tracker which enables friends, family and the ride organisers to follow your progress and is used to validate the time and route. The ride is split into two categories: Solo and Pairs.
